docs.text: Tetra Tetra is installed by the dotool bootstrap process. Part The Nodeholder Process Obtain an Digital Ocean API Key Install doctl on your local machine Clone devops-study-group cloning into ~/src/devops-study-group makes things easiest source ~/src/devops-study-group/dotool.sh dotool-create name will create an LTS node with hostname name. add IP info into the ~/server.list file ssh root@$name Clone devops-study-group into /root/src/devops-study-group source ~/src/devops-study-group/nh Recall: dotool-create: 1. provisions an LTS Ubuntu VPS with a Hypervisor Steward Key after creating a virtual private server on a hypervisor system like Digital Ocean. Tetra provides: a collection of Bash functions for Linux OS a system for managaging network data a simple SSH key manager a mesh network builder based on systemctl a turnk-key virtual private cloud a Jump Server (aka bastion server) for audited access a tool for monitoring disk usage hot backup via rsync cold backup via gzip to volumes deep backup via mounted S3 storage Tetra does not use: - docker - custom logging software instead relies on TCP/IP traffic secured with SSH (not SSL). Setup Clone devops-study-group Explore - tetra- tab will show you all commands. Theory
